title: Cong 'unity show' flatlines? Shivakumar backs Siddaramaiah; says 'no option'
content: Tensions within the Karnataka Congress resurfaced as DK Shivakumar reluctantly pledged support to Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, despite earlier leadership change expectations. This development follows assurances from the party high command that Siddaramaiah will complete his full term, dismissing speculations of internal rifts and leadership shifts. The party is trying to project a united front amidst ongoing speculation.

title: 'Successor must be approved by us': China reacts strongly to Dalai Lama's remarks
content: China insists on approving the next Dalai Lama. However, the current Dalai Lama says the selection should follow Tibetan Buddhist traditions. He reiterated this ahead of his 90th birthday. The Dalai Lama has entrusted the Gaden Phodrang Trust with overseeing the search. The current Dalai Lama fled to India in 1959.

title: Trusting ChatGPT too much? OpenAI CEO to users; ‘It should be used like a… ’
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman cautions users against over-reliance on ChatGPT, highlighting its tendency to 'hallucinate' and produce unreliable information. Despite ongoing advancements and new features, Altman acknowledges the technology's limitations and emphasizes the need for transparency. He also reversed his stance on AI hardware, suggesting that current computers are inadequate for an AI-driven world.

title: 'Outrageous': Lawyer sips beer during virtual hearing; faces contempt proceedings
content: The Gujarat High Court initiated contempt proceedings against senior counsel Bhaskar Tanna after a video surfaced showing him drinking from a beer mug and talking on the phone during a virtual hearing. The court deemed Tanna's behavior "outrageous and glaring," emphasizing the potential damage to the rule of law if such actions are ignored.

title: 2nd Test: 'You have best fast bowler in world.' - Former India coach fumes
content: Former India coach Ravi Shastri has criticized the team management's decision to rest Jasprit Bumrah for a crucial Test match. Shastri questioned the logic of benching the world's best fast bowler after a week's rest, especially given India's recent Test losses.

title: Ousted B'desh PM Sheikh Hasina sentenced to 6-month jail term
content: The International Crimes Tribunal (ICT) in Bangladesh has sentenced ousted Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to six months in prison for contempt of court. The tribunal-1, led by Justice Md Golam Mortuza Mozumder, also sentenced Shakil Akand Bulbul to two months in prison. This marks Hasina's first conviction since leaving office and the country 11 months prior.

title: Microsoft layoffs: Sales head to go on 8 weeks leave; company says will be back with …
content: Microsoft is set to implement significant layoffs, primarily impacting its sales and marketing division, as part of an ongoing restructuring effort amid substantial AI investments. This move coincides with Chief Commercial Officer Judson Althoff's planned eight-week sabbatical, scheduled to conclude in September. The layoffs represent the third major workforce reduction this year for the tech giant.

title: Jockey Peta Tait dies in Melbourne stable accident; tributes pour in
content: The Australian horse racing community mourns the tragic loss of former jockey Peta Tait, who died in a workplace accident at a Cranbourne stable. The incident occurred when she was struck by a horse while working as a stable hand. Tributes have poured in, remembering Tait as a dedicated and passionate horsewoman.

title: Kolkata horror: Detective dept to take over case, say cops
content: Kolkata Police's Detective Department is now investigating the gangrape of a law student within a south Kolkata college. The survivor, a Trinamool student activist, was allegedly lured with a promise of a key post and then assaulted by three individuals, including a former student and current staff member.

title: REVEALED! Which Test will Bumrah play? Shubman finally answers the big question
content: India's pace bowler Jasprit Bumrah is set to rejoin the team for the third Test against England. The match will be held at Lord's next week. Shubman Gill confirmed Bumrah's return. Bumrah was rested for the second Test as part of workload management. Three changes were made to the team for the second Test.

title: Trump's warning to Elon Musk on 'Big Beautiful Bill': 'May have to close up shop ...'
content: Donald Trump has escalated his feud with Elon Musk, threatening to withdraw federal subsidies from Musk's companies and suggesting he return to South Africa. This stems from Musk's criticism of the "Big Beautiful Bill," which Trump supports, and Musk's threat to form a new political party. Musk, in turn, advocates for eliminating all subsidies, even those benefiting his own ventures.

title: Cheer for middle class soon? GST rates may come down on household items, say reports
content: The Goods and Services Tax slabs may be revamped soon, according to media reports. The government is planning to lower GST rates for household items, the reports claim. Gross GST collections reached a record high in fiscal year 2024-25.

title: Viral video: 'Jija kaun hai Indian team ka?' - Gambhir and Pant reveal
content: The Great Indian Kapil Show's upcoming episode features Rishabh Pant, coach Gautam Gambhir, Yuzvendra Chahal, and Abhishek Sharma. Pant humorously declares, "Don't take me for a sage." Gambhir jests about needing the players' permission and explains his serious demeanor allows others to enjoy. The cricketers playfully reveal Mohammed Shami as the biggest complainer, with Gambhir adding Shami misses his brother-in-law.

title: IND vs ENG: Why was Kuldeep Yadav not picked? Captain Gill provides update
content: India chose Washington Sundar over Kuldeep Yadav for the second Test against England at Edgbaston, prioritising batting depth. Shubman Gill cited the desire to strengthen the lower order, influenced by past batting performances and the inclusion of all-rounder Nitish Kumar Reddy. Jasprit Bumrah was also rested due to workload management, with an eye on the third Test at Lord's.

title: Girls skipped classes: How rape accused 'Mango's' return turned Kolkata law college into danger zone
content: Kolkata's law college faces turmoil as Monojit Mishra, accused of rape, returns as ad-hoc staff, triggering sharp drop in female student attendance. Students report feeling unsafe due to his intimidating presence and harassment. Mishra, previously expelled for criminal activities, allegedly controls the campus, accessing student data and threatening individuals.

title: Kanye West denied entry to Australia after releasing track 'Heil Hitler'
content: Kanye West, also known as Ye, has been officially denied entry into Australia after his latest track, “Heil Hitler,” sparked global outrage with its antisemitic lyrics and Nazi references. Immigration Minister Tony Burke confirmed the visa revocation, citing character grounds under Australia’s Migration Act.

title: IND vs ENG 2nd Test: Bumrah rested, blow to Sai! England opt to field
content: England opted to bowl first after winning the toss in the second Test at Edgbaston, capitalizing on overcast conditions. India rested Jasprit Bumrah to manage his workload, bringing in Nitish Kumar Reddy, Washington Sundar, and Akash Deep. England retained their winning combination, aiming to build on their previous victory, while India sought to level the series.

title: 'Why do you have doubts?': Amid leadership change buzz, Siddaramaiah says he'll be CM for 5 yrs
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has firmly denied any leadership change, asserting his commitment to serving a full five-year term. He dismissed speculations fueled by opposition parties and addressed internal dissent rumors. Deputy CM D K Shivakumar and Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge had also commented on the matter.

title: US defence 'made in China': Is Washington ready for war with Beijing?
content: A report reveals the US defense sector's reliance on China. Chinese firms supply critical components for US defense programs. These programs include missile defense and nuclear systems. The US military supply chains are deeply connected with Beijing's industries. The report highlights US vulnerability due to China's dominance in critical minerals. Experts suggest dissecting critical components instead of complete decoupling.

title: Shubhanshu Shukla set to interact with students and ISRO scientists from space on July 4
content: Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla will interact with ISRO students and scientists from the International Space Station. The interaction will occur via ham radio on Friday. This event is part of the ARISS program. It aims to promote STEM education. The session will take place at the U R Rao Satellite Centre in Bengaluru.

title: Dalai Lama successor: India-based Gaden Phodrang Trust to pick next spiritual leader
content: The Dalai Lama has declared that the institution of the Dalai Lama will persist after his death, with the Gaden Phodrang Trust in India holding the authority to recognise his future reincarnation. He emphasised that the selection process should adhere to past Buddhist traditions, involving consultations with Tibetan Buddhist leaders and Dharma Protectors.

title: Cricket | India tour of Bangladesh could be rescheduled, says BCB official
content: India's scheduled white-ball tour of Bangladesh in August faces a potential postponement due to pending government clearance amidst diplomatic tensions. While cancellation is not an option as the series is part of the ICC's Future Tours Programme, both cricket boards are expected to discuss rescheduling to find mutually convenient dates. The series includes three ODIs and three T20Is.

title: IBPS Hindi Officer recruitment 2025 application window opens: Direct link here
content: The Institute of Banking Personnel Selection (IBPS) has launched the application process for Hindi Officer Grade E Recruitment 2025. The post, based at IBPS Mumbai, includes a selection process involving an online exam, skill test, and interview. Applications are open until July 15, 2025, via www.ibps.in, with the exam tentatively scheduled for July/August.

title: Shefali Jariwala’s demise: Forensic tests continue; exact cause still uncertain- Report
content: The sudden death of actress Shefali Jariwala has sparked an investigation into the cause. A postmortem at Cooper Hospital yielded no immediate answers, prompting further tissue and chemical analysis. Police investigations reveal Shefali fasted before consuming day-old rice and experiencing discomfort. She took medication and received an anti-aging treatment earlier that day.

title: Is Trump dealing with dementia? Psychologist cites ‘telltale’ sign
content: A psychologist, Dr. John Gartner, suggests Donald Trump may be showing early dementia signs, particularly in motor skills. He points to a "telltale" leg swing as potentially indicative of Frontotemporal dementia. Concerns about Trump's gait and mobility have surfaced, contrasting with past athletic abilities, despite a White House physician's report of excellent cognitive and physical health.

title: Sardaarji 3 controversy: Naseeruddin Shah deletes post backing Diljit Dosanjh movie
content: Veteran actor Naseeruddin Shah defended Diljit Dosanjh amidst controversy surrounding 'Sardaar Ji 3' due to the casting of Pakistani actress Hania Aamir. Shah criticized political parties for unfairly targeting Diljit, questioning the selective outrage. After facing backlash, Shah deleted his initial post but shared a cryptic quote about truth.

title: IND v ENG: 'Team's needs more important' - Ex-Eng cricketer on Bumrah's availability
content: Mark Butcher urges India to prioritise winning the Edgbaston Test over managing Jasprit Bumrah's workload, emphasising the importance of leveling the series after England's Headingley victory. Despite Bumrah's desire to play at Lord's, Butcher believes his presence is crucial at Edgbaston. Captain Gill confirms Bumrah's availability, with a decision pending pitch assessment.

title: How Trump's planned 'economic bunker buster' bill may impact India
content: US Senator Lindsey Graham proposes a 500% tariff on countries still trading with Russia, aiming to cripple Putin's war efforts in Ukraine. The bill targets nations like India and China, major buyers of Russian oil. India, now heavily reliant on Russian oil, faces potential tariffs on its exports to the US, despite ongoing trade agreement negotiations.

title: 2036 Olympics: India officially enter race to host Games, Ahmedabad named host city
content: An Indian delegation officially presented Ahmedabad's bid to host the 2036 Olympic and Paralympic Games. The bid emphasises the opportunity for young Indians to experience the Olympics at home, promoting the principle of global unity. However, the IOC has paused the host selection process for review due to members' concerns about involvement.

title: China can't choose: Dalai Lama plans to reincarnate - will be reborn abroad
content: The Dalai Lama, ahead of his 90th birthday, has declared that the institution of the Dalai Lama will persist after his death, a statement with significant implications for his global Buddhist followers. He emphasised that the Gaden Phodrang Trust, based in India, will have the exclusive authority to identify his successor, adhering to traditional Buddhist practices.

title: IND vs ENG: Former captain asks Gill to be proactive; wants Siraj, Jadeja to step up
content: Ajinkya Rahane has advised Shubman Gill to be more proactive as a captain, especially when defending a total, emphasizing the importance of seeking wickets and setting strategic fields. Rahane also highlighted the need for Mohammed Siraj and Ravindra Jadeja to step up if Jasprit Bumrah is absent.

title: 'Very spoilt': Trump warns of 35% tariff as trade deal with Japan falls apart
content: Donald Trump threatened Japan with tariffs of 30-35% if they continue to refuse American rice imports, citing a significant trade deficit. Despite data showing Japan purchased $298 million worth of US rice last year, Trump claimed they "won't take" it. Increased tariff rates may take effect for countries without agreements with Washington after July 9.

title: 'Jinnahwadi party': BJP slams Ajoy Kumar's 'Sikkim a neighbouring country' remark
content: Congress leader Ajoy Kumar triggered controversy by mistakenly referring to Sikkim as a neighboring nation while criticizing the government's foreign policy. The BJP seized on the remark, accusing the Congress of divisive politics and insulting the Northeast. Kumar apologized for the error but questioned the BJP's focus on real issues.

title: Egypt oil ship disaster: Vessel overturns in Gulf of Suez; four dead
content: An oil drilling ship capsized in the Gulf of Suez near Ras Ghareb, Egypt, resulting in at least four fatalities and four missing crew members. Egyptian authorities reported that 22 workers were rescued and hospitalized after the incident, which involved 30 personnel. The Egyptian navy is assisting in the ongoing search for the remaining missing individuals.

title: PM Modi on 5-nation tour: Ghana, Brazil & more on itinerary; Brics, trade in focus
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi embarked on a five-nation tour from July 2-9, visiting Ghana, Trinidad & Tobago, Argentina, Brazil, and Namibia. The trip aims to strengthen India's ties with the Global South, focusing on enhanced cooperation in various sectors like investment, energy, and technology. Modi will engage with leaders and address parliaments, reaffirming India's commitment to multilateral platforms and partnerships.

title: Gold price prediction today: Where is gold rate headed in the near future?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are expected to remain volatile due to evolving global economic conditions. Recent corrective moves followed easing geopolitical tensions and trade policy progress. Mixed economic data from the US, Euro area, UK, Japan, and India influenced market sentiment.

title: 'Perpetrators must be brought to justice': Quad leaders strongly condemn Pahalgam terror attack
content: The Quad foreign ministers strongly condemned the terrorist attack in Jammu and Kashmir, urging justice for the victims. They voiced concerns over the East and South China Seas, North Korea's missile launches and cyber activities, and the crisis in Myanmar. The Quad also announced initiatives for critical minerals, maritime law enforcement, disaster response, and countering disinformation in the Indo-Pacific region.

title: Shweta Tiwari's ex husband allegations: Can't meet daughter Palak
content: Raja Chaudhary, in a recent interview, refuted Shweta Tiwari's accusations of domestic violence during their marriage, which ended in 2012. He claimed Shweta demanded he never meet their daughter, Palak, as a condition for divorce. Raja expressed his sorrow over being cut off from Palak and his family, alleging Shweta used her influence to isolate them.

title: Elderly woman duped of ₹1.15 crore by cyber fraudsters over six years
content: 70-year-old Mumbai woman loses ₹1.15 crore to cyber scamsters posing as I-T officials over six years in Mumbai

title: HR&CE Department saw remarkable growth under Dravidian model government: T.N. CM Stalin
content: Speaking at a free mass wedding event organised for 32 couples in Chennai, Mr. Stalin said a total of 2,376 free mass weddings have been conducted through the department in the last four years, including the 576 ceremonies held on Wednesday

title: Maharashtra Assembly session: Opposition walks out over farmer deaths, delay in soybean payment
content: Congress leader Vijay Wadettiwar moved an adjournment motion seeking a discussion on the farmers issue; Speaker Rahul Narwekar, however, rejected the adjournment motion, following which Opposition members staged a walkout, accusing the government of insensitivity and avoiding discussion

title: Chellanam tetrapod: protest panel urges government to revisit piecemeal implementation of seawall construction
content: While welcoming government decision to erect tetrapod seawall on the Puthonthode-Cheriyakkadavu stretch, they say the decision is only a temporary relief

title: Grounded UK fighter jet gives Kerala Tourism a viral lift
content: F-35B fighter jet that remains grounded after making an emergency landing at Thiruvananthapuram airport on June 14 has sparked a flurry of trolls

title: Why PM Modi’s visit to Ghana matters: A look at India–Ghana bilateral relations
content: As Prime Minister Modi visits Ghana for the first time, India and the West African nation look to deepen decades-old ties across trade, development, and diplomacy. Here are the key things you need to know.

title: Kerala Industries department takes up rebranding exercise
content: New uniform colour scheme and style has been adopted for name boards of department and affiliated entities

title: Trivandrum Reads, an ardent group of bookworms in Thiruvananthapuram, celebrates reading and books
content: Trivandrum Reads, the silent reading community which meets every Saturday at the Napier Museum grounds, completes 100 sessions on July 5

title: Arrests, boat seizures will continue if Indian fishermen trespass, Sri Lanka warns
content: There is no room for leniency, says Fisheries Minister; Sri Lankan fishermen call for talks with Tamil Nadu counterparts

title: Telangana factory blast | Sigachi used old machinery despite requests to change, says FIR
content: The complaint was lodged by Yashwanth Rajanala, whose father was an employee of Sigachi for the past 20 years.

title: Madras High Court appoints mediator to resolve differences between Tamil film producers and FEFSI
content: Justice K. Kumaresh Babu requests retired judge M. Govindaraj to hold talks and submit a report to the court as early as possible

title: Chellanam tetrapod project: Kerala government approves ₹306-crore second phase
content: Proposed project to cover remaining 3.6-km stretch from Puthenthode to Cheriyakkadavu as was originally planned in first phase

title: Centre to file review plea against Madras HC order dispensing with husband’s signature in passport form
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh accepts a request made by Additional Solicitor General AR.L. Sundaresan for early hearing of the plea seeking clarification

title: Three killed in landslip in Odisha's Keonjhar: police
content: Illegal manganese mining in Odisha leads to landslip, killing three; bodies recovered and identified by police

title: Telangana pharma factory blast: One more body recovered from site, death toll rises to 37
content: Families of the workers still missing or unidentified waited outside, some clutching photographs, others simply hoping for a word

title: Politics of division creeping into Kerala society: Minister Saji Cherian
content: Saji Cherian says while one group was opposing zumba dance, another was deliberately targeting the film JSK – Janaki vs State of Kerala

title: Siddaramaiah asserts he will be Karnataka Chief Minister for full five-year term
content: The Congress leader ended speculation of a power-sharing agreement that was rumoured to give D.K. Shivakumar the Chief Minister’s chair later this year

title: LDF in Kerala scrambles to counter Opposition claims of public health sector decline
content: Editorial in CPI(M) mouthpiece Deshabhimani states contentious social media post by Dr. Haris Chirackal inadvertently provided grist for Opposition and right-wing media to obscure Kerala’s stellar achievements in public health sector

title: Devanahalli farmers to hold day-long fast on July 2 at Channarayapatna
content: The fast seeks to put pressure on the government to take up their issue as a special agenda during State Cabinet meeting.

title: Supreme Court to hear Uddhav Thackeray’s plea to use ‘Shiv Sena’ name, party symbol for local elections on July 14
content: Making an urgent oral mentioning before a Vacation Bench of Justices M.M. Sundresh and Vinod Chandran, senior advocate Devadatt Kamat, for Mr. Thackeray, said the State Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde and his group must be restrained from using the party name, the reserved symbol and the flag with the emblem

title: Anbumani removes Ramadoss loyalist and Salem West MLA R. Arul from PMK’s primary membership
content: In a press release, Dr. Anbumani accused Mr. Arul of acting in a manner that went against the party’s disciplinary rules

title: 'Debt of 'Achhe Din': Congress slams Govt over rise in per capita debt of individual borrowers
content: Ramesh said the latest report of the Reserve Bank of India has revealed a worrying picture of India’s economy

title: Telangana | It was an accident, not caused by reactor explosion: Sigachi
content: The “accident resulted in the loss of 40 valued team members and left over 33 injured,” said Company Secretary and Compliance Officer

title: Sivaganga custodial death: Victim’s brother given government job; Minister hands over appointment order
content: Chief Minister M.K. Stalin had spoken to the family over the phone and assured them of necessary assistance

title: Himachal Pradesh monsoon rains: At least 10 more dead in separate incidents of cloud bursts, flash floods
content: While ten people have lost their lives in torrential monsoon rains since the intervening night of Monday (June 30, 2025) to Tuesday (July 1, 2025), at least 34 people are missing in Mandi district alone, which has been among the worst hit

title: Defamation case against Rahul Gandhi: Court adjourns hearing till July 14
content: MP-MLA court adjourns hearing in defamation case, filed by BJP leader Vijay Mishra, against Rahul Gandhi over his remarks against Amit Shah

title: MLA Hemant Khandelwal elected Madhya Pradesh BJP president
content: Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan declared Khandelwal, the MLA from Betul, as the new State BJP head

title: Phones cannot be tapped for covert operations aimed at crime detection, rules Madras High Court
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh says the law, as it stands today, permits the tapping of telephone conversations and messages only for limited purposes

title: Man injured as IED planted by Maoists explodes in Chhattisgarh’s Bijapur
content: The injured man inadvertently stepped on the pressure IED, which exploded; he suffered serious injuries on his legs and face, police said

title: ECI to take cognisance of only registered party heads for meeting  over special revision of electoral rolls in Bihar
content: Opposition parties led by the Congress have opposed the Special Intensive Revision saying it would lead to disenfranchisement of a large number of people in the State

title: Thane food stall owner thrashed by MNS workers for not speaking in Marathi
content: Members of the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena have been trying to push for the use of Marathi language in commercial establishments and banks in the State.

title: Won't accept three-language policy even in future: Sanjay Raut
content: Facing mounting opposition to the introduction of Hindi language in Maharashtra schools from classes 1 to 5, the State cabinet on Sunday decided to withdraw two government orders

title: Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel launches Jan Suraksha Santrupti Abhiyan in Gandhinagar
content: At the event, the Chief Minister gave cheques of ₹2 lakh each to three beneficiaries under the Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana and handed over a Jan Dhan passbook to one account holder

title: Hope U.S. can complete major pending defence sales to India: Defence Secretary Hegseth
content: U.S. Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth said the U.S. and India are “mutually aware of the security concerns in the region, and both nations have the ability to counter that threat together”

title: U.K. to acquire 15 more F-35B fighter jets despite Kerala grounding incident
content: The grounding at Thiruvananthapuram airport has raised concerns over the combat jet’s operational ability

title: Did not refer to Kasba incident says West Bengal Minister after his ‘small incident’ remark creates outrage
content: The Trinamool Congress leadership, also came to the Minister’s defense and said an excerpt from Manas Bhuniya‘s speech has been “maliciously taken out of context, misquoted, and circulated to mislead viewers about the Kasba incident”.

title: West Bengal BJP to get a new president on July 3
content: The BJP is going to elect a new party president for West Bengal with less than a year remaining before the State goes to Assembly polls in 2026

title: Parliament security breach: Delhi HC grants bail to accused Neelam Azad, Mahesh Kumawat
content: The Judge also directed them not to give interviews to media outlets or make social media posts related to the incident

title: Remembering T.T. Vasu, the man who could never say no
content: The youngest son of T.T. Krishnamachari and Rajalakshmi, T.T. Vasu lost his mother when he was very young. His upbringing was largely left to an indifferent grandmother

title: Maharashtra govt announces ex-gratia aid for warkaris in case of mishaps during Pandharpur pilgrimage
content: Scheme offers ₹4 lakh for accidental death and financial assistance for disability and hospitalisation.

title: Lifestyle and pre-existing condition and not COVID-19 vaccination key factor of sudden deaths among adults post COVID: Health Ministry
content: Studies by the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) and National Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) affirm that COVID-19 vaccines in India are safe and effective, with extremely rare instances of serious side effects, the Union Health Ministry said

title: ED searches multiple locations in Delhi over cyber fraud case involving Chinese national
content: Five premises in Delhi are being searched in the case against a company named Xindai Technologies Pvt Ltd; it is alleged that general public was cheated in the name of investments and funds were laundered using full fledged money changers

title: Security forces arrest 4 militants in Manipur
content: Intelligence-based combing operations and cordon and search operations are being carried out extensively to nab those involved in extortion and criminal activities in the State

title: Dalai Lama affirms reincarnation after his death, China says it must approve successor
content: The spiritual head of Tibetan Buddhism asserted that the Gaden Phodrang Trust has sole authority to recognise the future reincarnation, adding that “no one else has any such authority to interfere in this matter”

title: Quad condemns Pahalgam terror attacks, calls for perpetrators to be brought to justice
content: First Quad FM meet narrows focus on China, Indo-Pacific, maritime issues, drops references to Ukraine and Gaza

title: Development of Amaravati: A.P. govt. prescribes a new set of LPS rules
content: The scheme was titled the Land Pooling Scheme, under which land parcels owned by individual farmers or groups of owners were consolidated by the CRDA as per comprehensive development plan

title: L-G flags off first batch of Amarnath Yatra pilgrims from Jammu amid multi-tier security
content: A batch of 5,892 pilgrims, including 1,115 women, 31 children and 16 transgenders left the base camp in the first batch at 4.30 a.m. to join the annual Amarnath pilgrimage

title: PM Modi embarks on 5-nation visit, says ‘India committed to BRICS’
content: During the week-long travel, the PM will visit Ghana, Trinidad and Tobago, Argentina, Brazil and Namibia

title: Truckers go on strike against e-challans in Maharashtra; ‘mixed response’, says transporters’ body
content: The transporters’ demands include stopping forceful recovery of e-challan fines, cancellation of e-challans older than six months, waiving existing penalties, scrapping the mandatory cleaner rule for heavy vehicles, and reconsidering no-entry timings in metro cities

title: Talks on India-U.S. trade pact enter 6th day; India pushes for duty cuts for labour-intensive sectors
content: India has hardened its position on giving duty concessions to American farm products. It is seeking duty concessions for its labour-intensive goods such as textiles, engineering, leather, gems and jewellery

title: Feud between Dr. Ramadoss and Dr. Anbumani creates deep rooted factionalism in PMK
content: Sources in the party said that the ‘competitive’ appointments made by Dr. Ramadoss and Dr. Anbumani to key party posts from district level right down to the grassroots have already created two party structures

title: Karnataka to launch 393 Asha Kirana vision centres to tackle preventable blindness
content: The initiative is aimed at increasing access to eye health services, particularly targeting cataracts and uncorrected refractive errors

title: Uttarakhand makes it mandatory for eateries on Kanwar Yatra route to display food licenses
content: Action will be taken against businessmen who do not follow these instructions under Section 55 of the Food Safety Act 2006, in which a fine of up to ₹2 lakh can be imposed

title: Centre allows use of white board bikes for passenger journeys through aggregators
content: This move brings relief to bike taxi operators like Rapido and Uber, who have long operated in a legal grey area, especially in states like Karnataka, where a recent ban on bike taxis had led to widespread protests

title: Most parts in A.P. likely to receive normal rainfall in July, says IMD
content: Thunderstorms, accompanied by lightning, are likely to occur in isolated places across Andhra Pradesh until July 7, suggests weather forecast

title: Polavaram irrigation project will be commissioned in 2027, says A.P. CM Naidu
content: The NDA government has attracted investment worth ₹9.5 lakh crore to the State in a year, with the potential to create 8.5 lakh jobs, says CM

title: Goa man throws acid on teenage boy to avenge his daughter's suicide; arrested
content: The accused told the police that he stole a five-litre acid can on Friday from the company in Goa where he was employed and hid it in his scooter

title: P.V.N. Madhav takes charge as BJP A.P. unit president, promises to strengthen NDA
content: Madhav vows to resolve internal differences among the alliance partners and secure a stronger role for the BJP within the government

title: YSRCP sympathiser was crushed under Jagan’s vehicle: Naidu
content: Videos gathered by the police during the investigation and forensic report have established that the elderly man was crushed under the vehicle of the YSRCP president, says the Chief Minister

title: When a mysterious tape recorder exploded severely injuring Tamil music director Ganesh
content: The Chennai city police set up two special teams to crack the case. All they had to proceed with was a handwritten note that came with the parcel, containing instructions for activating the deadly device concealed inside what appeared to be a cassette player.

title: During Emergency, Tamil Nadu exceeded targets for male sterilisation under family planning programme
content: However, the State government did not furnish information on the number of cases of sterilisation of unmarried persons, persons having two or less children and persons more than 55 years of age.

title: Groundwater crisis deepens in Karnataka’s hard rock terrain
content: A new study suggests the primary cause of borewell abandonment is severe depletion of the water table rather than groundwater quality issues

title: Minister Eshwar Khandre seeks report on the deaths of tigers in the last five-and-a-half years in Karnataka
content: Expressing shock over media reports claiming that 82 tigers had died in the State in the last five-and-a-half years, he sought a report to be submitted within 10 days

title: Chennai woman dies four days after wedding; dowry harassment by husband, in-laws alleged
content: She was harassed by the in-laws to bring one sovereign of gold jewellery and an AC. Ponneri police arrested Panneer and his mother Poongothai. Efforts on to nab his father Ezhumalai and his sister

title: Six held for exchanging bribes to give favourable report to medical colleges
content: The six accused were arrested when the bribe amount of ₹55 lakh was exchanging hands. The money was delivered in Bengaluru

title: 44 days on, Gulzar Houz fire probe panel awaits direction; another formed for Sangareddy blast
content: The committee was expected to investigate the incident, assess departmental lapses, and recommend safety measures

title: Pharma factory blast: Over 300 officials in race to trace six missing workers; Factories department suspect static charge and pressure build-up
content: Officials confirmed that 143 individuals were at the facility at the time of the explosion, of whom 74 were affected

title: Over 97,000 criminals convicted under ‘Operation Conviction’ since July 2023: U.P. government
content: ‘In a major success against the mafia, 29 out of 69 identified mafias were convicted, reaffirming that the crackdown is not limited to petty offenders,’ the U.P. government said in a statement

title: Digital copy of certified adoption orders valid, clarifies Central Adoption Resource Authority
content: Clarifying the term "certified copy," CARA said it refers to a digitally authenticated version bearing official attestation, and not a physical original or hard copy.

title: Shipwreck: PIL filed before Kerala HC seeking environmental security deposit
content: The vessel was carrying 643 containers, including 244 with hazardous and noxious substances, 58 with foreign waste, and over 450 metric tonnes of marine fuel.

title: Rains continue to batter Himachal; cloudbursts, flash floods create havoc
content: At least 17 people have died since June 20 in rain-related incidents, which include flash floods, drowning, and electrocution

title: Judiciary should not override executive’s decision to deport a foreign national: Home Ministry
content: The Ministry has appealed against a Jammu and Kashmir High Court order to repatriate a 62-year-old woman who was deported to Pakistan post Pahalgam terror attack

title: Tiruppur dowry death: Husband, in-laws subjected Rithanya to cruelty, reveals police investigation
content: A. Rithanya, daughter of a real estate dealer from Kaikattipudur in Tiruppur, and E. Kavinkumar of Pazhangarai near Avinashi got married on over two months ago on April 11

title: 'Reckless': What league insiders are saying about this stunning set of Bucks moves
content: Damian Lillard waived, Myles Turner to Milwaukee: Here's what the surprise moves mean for the Bucks, the Pacers and the NBA.

title: 'Resilient' Fever, missing Clark, win in-season title
content: Despite being without star Caitlin Clark and playing the league's first-place team on its home court, the 10.5-point underdog Fever defeated the Lynx 74-59 to win the WNBA Commissioner's Cup.

title: Gauff 'mentally overwhelmed,' falls at Wimbledon
content: Coco Gauff became just the third woman in the Open era to lose in the first round at Wimbledon right after winning the championship at the French Open, eliminated 7-6 (3), 6-1 by unseeded Dayana Yastremska of Ukraine on Tuesday night.

title: Sources: Pistons add Robinson in sign-and-trade
content: Free agent sharpshooter Duncan Robinson has agreed to a three-year, $48 million deal with the Detroit Pistons, sources told ESPN on Tuesday.

title: Penn to ban trans athletes, ending Thomas case
content: The University of Pennsylvania has agreed to ban transgender women from its women's sports teams to resolve a federal civil rights case.

title: Red Panda injured during Fever-Lynx halftime
content: The popular halftime performer Red Panda was injured at the start of her act at the WNBA Commissioner's Cup championship game at Target Center on Tuesday.

title: Astros' Alvarez to see hand specialist after setback
content: Astros slugger Yordan Alvarez has experienced a setback in his recovery from a broken right hand and will see a specialist.

title: Springer's 7 RBIs help Jays pile on Yankees late
content: George Springer had a career-high seven RBIs, including his ninth grand slam, to help the Blue Jays beat the Yankees 12-5, drawing within one game of the AL East leaders.

title: Sources: Bucks waive Lillard, agree with Turner
content: The Bucks are waiving Damian Lillard and stretching the remaining $113M on his contract in order to acquire free agent center Myles Turner, sources told ESPN.

content: Bobby Bo hasn't played for the Mets since 1999, but Tuesday he'll receive his annual hefty check from the team.

content: Playing without Caitlin Clark, Indiana had its best defensive effort of 2025 to win the Commissioner's Cup.

title: Hayes: U.S. entering 'next phase' ahead of WWC
content: USWNT head coach Emma Hayes said she "feel[s] like we're entering the next phase" as she narrows her player pool ahead of the 2027 Women's World Cup.

title: Guirassy's double sends Dortmund to CWC QF
content: Serhou Guirassy scored a brace in the first half to lead Borussia Dortmund to a 2-1 victory over Monterrey in the Club World Cup's round of 16, setting up a quarterfinal match against Real Madrid.

title: Toronto ends contracts of Insigne, Bernardeschi
content: Toronto FC have mutually agreed to terminate the contracts of former Italy internationals Lorenzo Insigne and Fernando Bernadeschi, the MLS club announced Tuesday.

title: Kepa joins Arsenal in $6.9M deal from Chelsea
content: Arsenal have completed a deal to sign goalkeeper Kepa Arrizabalaga from Chelsea, the club has confirmed.

content: Haslam Sports Group has sold a 10% stake in the Columbus Crew to the Edwards family at a franchise valuation of $900 million, Sportico reported Tuesday.

title: Ibrahimovic: 'Messi plays with statues' at Miami
content: Zlatan Ibrahimovic defended Lionel Messi following Inter Miami's elimination from the FIFA Club World Cup and likened the superstar's teammates to "statues."

title: Early Club World Cup exit gives Man City time to plan return to Premier League summit
content: Man City's Club World Cup stay was sweet, but all too short. The silver lining, though, is it gives the club time to recover from a disaster 2024-25.

content: Bayern Munich are set to step up their interest in Manchester United's Marcus Rashford.  Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Builder Ends Life In Palghar, Family Alleges Harassment By 2 Cops, Aide
content: A builder allegedly committed suicide at his residence at Nalasopara in Palghar district of Maharashtra apparently over financial matters, police said on Tuesday.

title: "What Option Do I Have?" DK Shivakumar Says Will Stand By Siddaramaiah
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has made it clear that he intends to serve the full five-year term in office, pushing back against speculation of a mid-term change in leadership.

title: Man Accused Of Killing 2 Idaho Firefighters Had Once Aspired To Be One
content: A 20-year-old man's life appeared to have begun to unravel in the months before authorities say he fatally shot two firefighters and severely wounded a third as they responded to a wildfire near Coeur d'Alene, Idaho.

title: Visa, Mastercard Race to Capture a $253 Billion Crypto Threat
content: A turf war is breaking out in the vast world of digital payments - and the incumbents are suddenly on defense.

title: Global Matcha 'Obsession' Drinks Japan Tea Farms Dry
content: At a minimalist Los Angeles matcha bar, powdered Japanese tea is prepared with precision, despite a global shortage driven by the bright green drink's social media stardom.

title: Missing Since 1995: Where Is The Boy Chosen By The Dalai Lama?
content: A six-year-old boy, who was seen as a reincarnation of one of Tibetan Buddhism's most important spiritual figures in May 1995, hasn't been seen in the last 30 years.

title: Delhi Court Directs Jal Board To Inspect Areas Getting Contaminated Water
content: A bench of Chief Justice D K Upadhyaya and Justice Tushar Rao Gedela directed the Delhi Jal Board (DJB) authorities to ensure that pure drinking water is provided to the residents.

title: Giant Trump Tax Bill Faces Make-Or-Break Vote In Congress
content: Donald Trump is seeking final approval Wednesday in the US Congress for his marquee tax and spending bill, with Republicans pinning their hopes on a narrow victory that will help seal the president's legacy.

title: The Shinawatras: Thailand's 21st Century Political Clan
content: Thailand's billionaire Shinawatra dynasty has dominated the kingdom's politics for 25 years, but its rule has been hit by coups and court cases.

title: 4 Of A Rajasthan Family Die By Suicide, Bodies Found In Water Tank
content: Four members of a family, including a woman, allegedly died by suicide by jumping into a water tank in Rajasthan's Barmer district, police said Wednesday.

title: Delhi-Jaipur In 3 Hours: Trial Run On Expressway Link Begins
content: The trial run on the Bandikui-Jaipur Link Expressway, connecting the Delhi-Mumbai Expressway to Jaipur, started on Wednesday. The journey from Jaipur to Delhi will now take just 2.5 to 3 hours, offering a faster and smoother travel experience.

title: Pilots Recreated AI-171's Final Moments On Simulator. What They Found
content: The pilots attempted to simulate electrical failures that could cause a dual-engine flame-out, resulting in an inability of the aircraft to climb post takeoff.

title: 'Remember Charlie Hebdo!' Protesters Seethe At Istanbul Magazine
content: Angry protesters rallied in Istanbul on Tuesday despite a heavy police presence, shouting threats following allegations a satirical magazine published a cartoon of the Prophet Mohammed.

title: Two Dead As France Registers Second-Hottest June On Record
